## Bootstrap Functions 

```{r}
#Inverse cumulative distribution function.
#Returns the value of a desired percentile from a given dataset. 
icdf = function(data,a){
  if(a <= 0.5){
    i = floor(a*(length(data)+1))
  }else{
    i = (length(data)+1) - floor((1-a)*(length(data)+1))
  }
  data = sort(data)
  return(data[i])
}
```

For example, Table 1 gives the serum cholesterol levels (mg per 100 mL of blood) for 25 males and is taken from Koopmans (1987). Suppose we wanted to find the $25^{th}$ percentile, or the $50^{th}$ percentile (median).

```{r, echo=FALSE}
table1 = matrix(c(106,138,146,153,153,158,160,174,180,180,190,191,198,203,207,215,217,223,241,242,251,260,265,280,305), nrow = 5, ncol = 5)

gt(as.data.frame(table1)) %>% 
  tab_header(
    title = "Serum Cholesterol Levels",
    subtitle = "n = 25 males"
  ) %>% 
  tab_options(column_labels.hidden = TRUE)
```
